report_title: Industry Report on Hiking and Outdoor Equipment Stores
executive_summary: Hiking and outdoor equipment stores have seen impressive growth in recent years, fueled by a surge in participation in outdoor activities. As people sought refuge and recreation in nature, expenditure on hiking, camping and climbing gear went up, leading to a significant boost in overall recreation spending. Industry revenue grew at a CAGR of 8.8% through the end of 2024 to $15.9 billion, including an anticipated 2.6% climb in 2024 alone. Profit has also expanded over the past five years as revenue has surged.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising popularity of outdoor activities boosts demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent years, there has been a notable trend toward outdoor activities as people seek safe and healthy ways to spend their leisure time. This shift has increased demand for hiking, camping, climbing and kayaking gear, positively impacting the Hiking and Outdoor Equipment Stores industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Influencers on social media heavily impact market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Social media platforms like Instagram, TikTok and YouTube have become significant drivers of consumer interest and purchasing decisions in the hiking and outdoor equipment market. Influencers and outdoor enthusiasts frequently share their adventures and gear recommendations, which heavily influence brand perception and sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Stores shift focus online to secure more of market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Competition stemming from Amazon and other large companies has expanded. Facing heightened competition and the potential loss of business, hiking and outdoor stores have developed comprehensive apps that allow them to offer their products online.

Consumers are increasingly looking for multi-functional and versatile gear that can be used for various activities and everyday wear, blurring the lines between traditional "outdoor" and everyday clothing and equipment. This has created opportunities for stores to offer products that cater to these evolving needs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Hiking gear sales will suffer as big retail enters
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: One-stop shop retailers, like Walmart and Target, have been entering the industry by carrying related product offerings in all their stores. Because of this, downward pressure on demand will continue, limiting revenue growth and expansion.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Sustained recreation expenditure will support demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Total expenditure on recreation and participation levels will continue expanding. The rising health consciousness across the United States will persist into the next period, further supporting activities related to hiking and outdoor pursuits. Consequently, stores specializing in outdoor equipment can anticipate sustained demand for their products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Stores will get creative to gain customers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Stores will likely embrace circular economy practices to promote sustainability and cater to environmentally conscious consumers. This includes offering pre-owned equipment at discounted prices, providing in-store repair services and partnering with rental companies to offer customers options to try out equipment before purchasing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Climate conditions will shape outdoor activity trends
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Changing climate conditions and unpredictable weather patterns will influence outdoor activity trends and equipment needs. For instance, irregular snowfall or prolonged droughts will alter hiking and camping plans, prompting consumers to seek gear adaptable to various climate conditions.

industry_definition: Retailers in this industry primarily sell hiking and outdoor sports equipment, with a specific focus on camping and hiking supplies. Specialty sports stores, like golf, paddle sport or ski shops, general sports stores and online-only retailers are excluded from the industry.

threats: External competition for the Sporting Goods Stores industry

key_trends: Hiking and outdoor equipment stores shift their focus online
Recreation expenditure and outdoor activity participation will expand
Three firms dominate a market portion
Hiking and outdoor equipment stores are required to adhere to a range of regulations

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market includes individuals and households with annual earnings below $25,000. Even with budget-friendly options, the initial investment in essential equipment like backpacks, tents, footwear, and appropriate clothing can still be prohibitive for some individuals with limited income. Individuals with lower incomes might prioritize essential needs like housing, food, and transportation, leaving less disposable income for discretionary spending on outdoor gear and activities.

This age group typically includes young adults, professionals and families with varying disposable incomes and leisure time levels. Younger individuals might be more likely to prioritize adventure and exploration.

These are consumers with annual earnings between $50,000 to $99,999. Individuals in this income bracket often prioritize healthy lifestyles and outdoor activities for fitness, stress relief and connecting with nature, leading to a higher demand for gear. Consumers in this market invest in a mix of mid-range and premium products, valuing quality and price. They often purchase durable hiking gear, advanced footwear and multi-functional outdoor gadgets. Their consistent purchasing behavior supports steady revenue growth and efficient inventory turnover, ensuring that mid-range and high-end products sell reliably and contribute to overall market stability.

Consumers with higher incomes have more disposable income, allowing them to spend more on outdoor equipment and gear like GPS devices, high-end tents, custom-fit hiking boots and specialized mountaineering gear. This translates to a higher willingness to pay for premium brands, advanced features and specialized products. Some high-income individuals may be more inclined to pursue adventure travel and expeditions, which often necessitate specialized equipment tailored for specific outdoor environments or activities.

products_and_services.product_description: Apparel encompasses outdoor-specific clothing like jackets, pants, shirts and accessories for hiking and camping. This product segment is influenced by seasonal trends, leading to periodic spikes in revenue during spring and fall.

Equipment and gear include tents, sleeping bags, backpacks and cooking equipment essential for outdoor activities. These high-value products often come with higher profit, significantly contributing to overall store revenue.

Footwear includes hiking boots, trail-running shoes and outdoor sandals designed for various terrains and weather conditions. Sales of footwear rely on comfortability, durability and brand recognition.

Other includes miscellaneous items like hydration systems, climbing equipment, navigation tools and safety gear. Though individually smaller in sales, these products collectively contribute significantly by offering a wide range of essentials.

tier_1_buyers: Sporting Goods Wholesaling in the US
Toy & Craft Supplies Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Total recreation expenditure monitors the annual consumer spending on recreational services in the US. When spending on outdoor recreational services increases, it often correlates with a higher demand for hiking and outdoor equipment. Consequently, a climb in total recreation expenditure could signal a potential growth opportunity for stores specializing in hiking and outdoor gear.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is among the fastest-growing regions in the United States, characterized by a rapidly expanding population.
The Western region has numerous national parks, mountain ranges and vast public lands that attract outdoor enthusiasts.
The Mid-Atlantic region offers access to various outdoor landscapes, such as the Appalachian Mountains, Shenandoah Valley and numerous state parks.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Robinson-Patman Act (1936) mandates fair pricing practices, preventing manufacturers from offering discriminatory pricing to different retailers.
The Federal Consumer Credit Protection Act (1968) impacts hiking and outdoor equipment stores by ensuring transparent credit terms for consumers.
The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) details the federal minimum wage.
The Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act (1970) impacts the industry by regulating how they use consumer credit information for financing options.
OSHA mandates that employers prominently display the OSHA workers' rights poster in an easily accessible location for all employees.

basis_points.basis_description: Mass merchandisers' purchasing power enables them to offer lower prices.
The surge in e-commerce shopping habits is gradually diverting key customers from traditional stores.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Online platforms such as Amazon have significantly diversified the market.

concentration_points.concentration_title: NICHE MARKETS AND PERSONALIZATION LIMIT CONCENTRATION
concentration_points.concentration_description: The outdoor market encompasses various sub-categories.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Consumers are increasingly prioritizing health and wellness.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: While most merchandise is typically purchased from wholesalers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Because of the Nature of the Work, Average Wages Remain Relatively Low
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Employees handle essential tasks like assisting customers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Seasonal Trends and Economic Factors Drive Volatility in Hiking and Outdoor Equipment Stores
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for outdoor equipment typically surges in the spring and summer.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Heightened Competition Introduces Greater Market Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Online retailers offer convenience, competitive prices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Technology Enhances Customer Experience in Hiking and Outdoor Equipment Stores
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The popularity of online shopping for hiking and outdoor equipment has surged over the past decade.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Innovations in Hiking Gear Feature Sustainability and Multi-Functionality
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Retailers are increasingly stocking items made from recycled materials.

FAQs.answer: Seasonality affects specific product types and demand for hiking and outdoor equipment stores.
